abstract: Alltel, the wireless telecommunications company, has stepped up efforts to sell itself to carriers such as AT&T, Verizon Communications and Sprint Nextel, The Wall Street Journal reported. According to The Journal, the wireless operator approached AT&T recently about the possibility of selling itself to the telecoms giant. AT&T is reportedly willing to entertain the possibility, but remains skeptical about a combination because of potential antitrust problems, technology-integration issues and Alltel’s stock-market capitalization, which Friday stood at nearly $22 billion.
lead_paragraph: Alltel, the wireless telecommunications company, has stepped up efforts to sell itself to carriers such as AT&T, Verizon Communications and Sprint Nextel, The Wall Street Journal reported. According to The Journal, the wireless operator approached AT&T recently about the possibility of selling itself to the telecoms giant. AT&T is reportedly willing to entertain the possibility, but remains skeptical about a combination because of potential antitrust problems, technology-integration issues and Alltel’s stock-market capitalization, which Friday stood at nearly $22 billion.

headline.main: Alltel Hopes to Dial Up a Deal, Report Says
